title: I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!: Start date for hotly-anticipated next series is CONFIRMED
text:
The start date for the next series of the I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here! 2019 has been confirmed.

The hotly anticipated show, which is fronted by Ant McPartlin and Declan Donnelly, will return to screens on Sunday November 17 on ITV.

The likes of Kate Garraway, Jacqueline Jossa and Ian Wright are all rumoured to be bravely swapping their lavish lifestyles for the Australian jungle.

Exciting! The start date for the next series of the I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here! 2019, hosted by Ant McPartlin and Declan Donnelly, has been confirmed

The new series marks Ant's first time back in the jungle since 2017, which came before his drink-drive arrest and subsequent break from presenting.

While Ant was replaced by presenter Holly Willoughby last series, bosses had previously confirmed that he would always return to the show following his TV hiatus.

Meanwhile, Kate Garraway, 52, was tipped to enter the jungle last year but was said to have pulled out of the series just weeks before filming was due to start.

Now the Good Morning Britain host has been tipped to make an epic return, with Kate herself fuelling the fires.

Back on screens: The hotly anticipated show, which crowned Harry Redknapp as King of The Jungle last year, will return to screens on Sunday November 17 on ITV

Step in: Ant was replaced by presenter Holly Willoughby last series, bosses had previously confirmed that he would always return to the show following his TV hiatus

Ready to go? The likes of Kate Garraway, Jacqueline Jossa and Ian Wright are all rumoured to be bravely swapping their lavish lifestyles for the Australian jungle

The mother-of-two has previously teased that her children Darcey, 13, and William, ten, are desperate to see her on the popular ITV programme.

Jacqueline, 26, is also tipped for a jungle stint, which supposedly came after her talks of returning to X Factor: Celebrity 'fizzled out'.

Jacqueline, whose husband Dan Osborne appeared on Celebrity Big Brother last year, is allegedly thinking about making her reality TV debut, according to the Daily Star.

A source revealed: 'Jacqueline will not be appearing in on Celebrity X Factor. She did have initial meetings about the possibility but it was decided that things wouldn't be taken any further.

'As a result she had also sat down with ITV about the prospect of going on I'm A Celeb. As ever, line-ups aren't locked in until closer the time but it is looking more than likely she will be heading Down Under.'

Swapping singing for the outback: Jacqueline, 26, is also tipped for a jungle stint, which supposedly came after her talks of returning to X Factor: Celebrity 'fizzled out'

The Wright stuff: Ian Wright, 55, could be one of the sportsmen in camp, and he already has the backing of a former Jungle King with Harrry Redknapp recommending him

Keeping it loud: The Sun on Sunday claims Nadine Coyle will be heading down under as TV bosses are keen to hear about the Girls Aloud feud

Ian, 55, could be one of the sportsmen in camp, and he already has the backing of a former Jungle King.

The former striker and football pundit is said to be in 'advanced talks' for the show, and is trying to fit a stint in the jungle into his busy schedule.

The Sun claims Nadine Coyle will be heading down under as TV bosses are keen to hear about the Girls Aloud feud.

A TV insider told the publication: 'Her link to Cheryl makes her an even more exciting prospect. It's no secret there's no love lost between them, and Nadine is refreshingly honest about what went on from her perspective.

Single and ready to mingle: Another controversial signing could be Rak-Su's Myles Stephenson following his split from Love Island star Gabby Allen, both 27

You asked for it! After confessing that he'd happily do a stint in the jungle, it appears that Roman Kemp could be getting his dream come true, as he is pipped to be in this year's line up

Another controversial signing could be Rak-Su's Myles Stephenson following his split from Love Island star Gabby Allen, both 27.

After confessing that he'd happily do a stint in the jungle, it appears that Roman Kemp could be getting his dream come true, as he is pipped to be in this year's line up.

The radio host is said to have caught producers eyes, as the son of Spandau Ballet's Martin Kemp and Wham! star Shirley has a plethora of showbiz pals.

Another well connected star tipped for the jungle is rugby player James Haskell.

He's got time: Another well connected star tipped for the jungle is rugby player James Haskell. The former England player is married to Richard Madeley and Judy Finnigan's daughter Chloe

From the cobbles to the outback: The final rumoured name began floating around on Sunday, with Coronation Street's Andrew Whyment being thrown into the ring

The final rumoured name is Coronation Street's Andrew Whyment.

Meanwhile, there has been a shake-up on the I'm A Celebrity: Extra Camp line-up as Emily Atack has been confirmed to replace Scarlett Moffatt.

The TV personality will be joining returning host Joel Dommett and fellow newcomer Adam Thomas to host the spin-off show, with Joe Swash also departing the programme.

They’ll get all the latest behind the scenes gossip with unseen clips, exclusive interviews and the insiders guide to the dreaded Bushtucker Trials.
description: The start date for the next series of the I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here! 2019 has been confirmed.
